Combine target information across multiple NULISAseq data objects

combine_targets.Rd

This helper function merges the target data frames from a list of processed NULISAseq data objects, returning a unified targets data frame and a vector of any excluded targets (those not present in all objects). Optionally, it adds a plateID column to each target data frame before merging.

Usage

combine_targets(dataList, plateID, addPlateID = TRUE)

Arguments

dataList

A list of processed NULISAseq data objects (as returned by mergeNULISAseq), each containing a `targets` data frame.

plateID

A character or factor vector of plate IDs for the data objects. Only required if `addPlateID = TRUE`.

addPlateID

Logical. If TRUE (default), adds a `plateID` column to each targets data frame before merging.

Value

A list with two elements:

targets

A unified data frame of all targets present in the input objects, with columns from the original targets data frames.

excluded

A character vector of target names that were excluded because they were not present in all input objects, or NULL if none.

Details

- All targets present in all input objects are retained in the merged targets data frame. - If some targets are missing from one or more objects, their names are returned in the `excluded` vector and a warning is logged. - Used internally for merging and aligning data matrices across plates.
